For a normal HTTP request like this:

GET /myApp/service HTTP/1.1
Accept: image/gif, image/x-xbitmap, image/jpeg, image/pjpeg, application/x-
shockwave-flash, application/vnd.ms-excel, application/vnd.ms-powerpoint, 
application/msword, */*
Accept-Language: en-us
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
User-Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 6.0; Windows NT 5.1; SV1; 
snprtz|T04029265762739)
Host: myHostName:9090
Connection: Keep-Alive
Cookie: JSESSIONID=ADCC5E8DE48131405C354933618460A5

hostName and port where request should be redirected are dicovered incorrect. 
JMeter tries to find host and port only into URL, whithout considering HOST 
field of header. 
In this way the hostName and port where request will be redirected is wrong.

text:
Not entirely sure I follow: are you saying that JMeter is handling redirects 
incorrectly? If so, I think this was fixed in SVN, and will be in the current 
nightly builds.

Or are you saying that JMeter does not handle the "Host" header correctly if 
you provide one via the HTTP Header Manager? If so, then that is really not a 
JMeter problem.
